title: Julian Edelman reflects on his Patriots Hall of Fame career: ‘Foxborough will always be my home’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Edelman, who was inducted into the Patriots Hall of Fame on Sunday, made some brief remarks on Sunday.
Julian Edelman speaks at halftime of the Patriots-Steelers game after being inducted into the team's Hall of Fame.

Matthew J Lee/Globe staff FOXBOROUGH – Sporting his brand new red Patriots Hall of Fame jacket, a pair of blue jeans, and black sunglasses, Julian Edelman jogged up to the podium at halftime and hugged team owner Robert Kraft.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ frustrating 21-14 loss to Steelers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots were knocked for five total turnovers in Sunday’s loss to the Steelers.
Drake Maye was knocked for two turnovers on Sunday.
(AP Photo/Robert F.

title: Suffolk County correction officer charged with rape after allegedly having sex with inmate
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The 37-year-old former correction officer allegedly had intercourse with the inmate in a caseworker's office while on duty.
Former correction officer William Cooper allegedly had sex with an inmate while on duty at South Bay House of Correction.

John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo September 21, 2025 | 10:52 AM 1 minute to read A former correction officer at the South Bay House of Correction is facing a rape charge after he had sexual intercourse with an inmate, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.

title: 5 key moments from ‘Dateline’ episode on Sandra Birchmore case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The 23-year-old teacher’s aide’s death was initially ruled a suicide before a forensic investigation years later determined that she was murdered.
Friday's episode of NBC's "Dateline" spotlighted Sandra Birchmore, who was allegedly murdered by a former Stoughton police officer.
Facebook By Darin Zullo September 21, 2025 | 10:00 AM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Wilyer Abreu set to return to the Red Sox Sunday vs. Rays
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox offense has taken a hit of late and are in need of Abreu's reliable bat.
Wilyer Abreu is ready to help the Red Sox clinch the postseason.
(Photo By Winslow Townson/Getty Images) The Red Sox have been inconsistent down the stretch offensively, but they are on the verge of getting a powerful bat back in the lineup on Sunday.

title: 5 takeaways from Julian Edelman, Bill Parcells Patriots Hall of Fame induction ceremony
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: New England Patriots Willie McGinest shared a story that perfectly captured Parcells's hard-nosed coaching style.
Bill Parcells and Julian Edelman joined the Patriots Hall of Fame on Saturday.
(Matthew J Lee/Globe staff) ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez won’t make season debut vs. Steelers
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez returned to practice this week and was initially ruled as questionable to play in Sunday's game.
Christian Gonzalez won't be putting on the pads this Sunday.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) The Patriots will have to wait another week before their top defensive player makes their season debut.

title: Only one Apple+ game remains, Red Sox fans, then it’s wait until next year for where to watch
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Boston Red Sox The national media rights deal is changing, and different subscriptions will be required if you don’t want to miss a single Red Sox game in 2026 and beyond.
Without a variety of subscriptions, Red Sox fans will be in the dark next season when it comes time to watch the team.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Chad Finn September 20, 2025 4 minutes to read Here’s the good news: The Red Sox have just one remaining regular-season game that will be carried on a channel or streaming service other than NESN.

title: Julian Edelman sees improvement with Patriots, but isn’t sure if they’re a playoff team yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Edelman is also noticing strong progress with Drake Maye and the Patriots' offense.
Julian Edelman likes the direction Patriots are heading in.
(Jim Davis/Globe Staff) The Patriots certainly aren’t playing at the level they played for much of Julian Edelman’s career.

title: 5 things to know about the Steelers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Steelers' defense hasn't been too successful to start the year, which is a good sign for the Patriots.
Aaron Rodgers is entering his third game with the Steelers.
(Brad Penner/AP Images for Panini) ShareSend this article to your social connections.
